New Records: Fakhar Zaman played an unbeaten knock of 126 and made history by smashing the fastest century for his country in World Cup history, bettering Imran Nazir's record.
Key Match Events: Pakistan defeated New Zealand by 21 runs via DLS method
Rachin Ravindra (108 off 94) scored his third century of the ongoing World Cup and together with skipper Kane Williamson (95 off 79) shared 180 runs for the second wicket
Fakhar Zaman and captain Babar Azam added 194 for the unbroken second wicket stand.
Glenn Phillips (41 off 25), Mark Chapman (39 off 27) and Daryl Mitchell (29 off 18) scored brisk runs towards the end to help New Zealand's cause.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan will need to chase the target in 35.2 overs to beat the Kiwis on net run rate (NRR) and keep their hopes alive in the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson said in a post-match presentation, "They deserved that result today, and for us it's about moving on to our next challenge".
Fakhar Zaman said, "We know that every game is do-or-die for us, and we will play aggressively."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rachin Ravindra has overtaken one of his idols, Indian legend Sachin Tendulkar, as he now has three World Cup centuries before turning 25 years of age.
Shaheen Afridi becomes the most expensive Pakistani bowler in World Cup history.
Others: Pakistan now have eight points from as many games with their last match against England in Kolkata on November 11.
Pakistan could sneak into the semifinals with its last league game scheduled against England on Nov 11.
